title: Harry Dunn death: Boris Johnson will ask Trump to intervene over US diplomat's wife's fatal crash in UK
text:
Boris Johnson will urge Donald Trump to intervene personally in the diplomatic immunity row, he said on Monday, as it emerged the American citizen alleged to have killed a British teenager had previously been fined for failing to pay due care and attention while driving.

The Prime Minister insisted that Anne Sacoolas, the wife of a US diplomat, should return to the UK to face justice over the death of 19-year-old Harry Dunn.

Mrs Sacoolas, 42, and her family quickly returned to the US after she allegedly hit the motorcyclist while driving on the wrong side of the road near RAF Croughton in Northamptonshire just three weeks after they had arrived in the UK. Her 12-year-old son was a passenger in the car, The Telegraph understands.

The US has refused to waive her diplomatic immunity, leading to an international outcry.

Mr Johnson said: “I do not think that it can be right to use the process of diplomatic immunity for this type of purpose.

“I hope that Anne Sacoolas will come back and will engage properly with the processes of law as they are carried out in this country.”
